body_html:
I looked into this briefly, it looks like numpy tries to figure out a dtype to use and ends up calling Tensor.numpy (through some __array__ call), and this fails because of the check here:

pytorch/tools/autograd/templates/python_variable_methods.cpp

Lines 388 to 392 in 27ea714

if (self_.requires_grad()) {
throw std::runtime_error(
"Can't call numpy() on Variable that requires grad. "
"Use var.detach().numpy() instead.");
}

If that fails, it enters a different code path, which returns the int64.

If that fails, it enters a different code path, which returns the int64.
body:
I looked into this briefly, it looks like numpy tries to figure out a dtype to use and ends up calling `Tensor.numpy` (through some `__array__` call), and this fails because of the check here: https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/27ea7148fecb88657c57e6e2f2b8d355d5d3ad78/tools/autograd/templates/python_variable_methods.cpp#L388-L392

If that fails, it enters a different code path, which returns the int64.
